I think I have just the thing for you! Have you considered "Total Recall"? It's an action-packed classic with Arnold Schwarzenegger as a factory worker who discovers his memories are fake and he's actually a spy. The special effects hold up surprisingly well, even by today's standards.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit more supernatural, "The Relic" might be up your alley. It's a horror-comedy about a detective and an anthropologist trying to stop a lizard-like god from wreaking havoc in a Chicago museum - it's got a great cast and some really fun moments!

Have you considered "A Farewell to Arms"? It's a classic romantic drama set against the backdrop of World War I, with beautiful performances from Helen Hayes and Gary Cooper. Or if you're in the mood for something more satirical, "Catch-22" might be right up your alley - it's a dark comedy that pokes fun at military bureaucracy during WWII.

Let me know if either of these strike a chord!

I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you enjoyed the emotional and introspective tone of "A Farewell to Arms", I'd highly recommend "Big Fish". It's a beautifully crafted film that explores the complexities of human relationships, with a dash of magic realism. The performances by Ewan McGregor and Albert Finney are outstanding, and the story will leave you pondering the nature of truth and memory.

If you're in the mood for something more action-packed, "The Patriot" might be up your alley! It's an intense historical drama that delves into the American Revolution, with Mel Gibson delivering a powerful performance as Benjamin Martin. The film's themes of love, loyalty, and sacrifice are sure to resonate with you.

If you're looking for something a bit different, I'd recommend "The Pianist" (2002). This powerful biographical drama tells the true story of Władysław Szpilman, a Polish Jewish pianist struggling to survive during WWII. With a critically acclaimed performance from Adrien Brody, this film is a must-see for anyone interested in historical dramas or music.

I think you might enjoy "American Sniper" (2014) - it's a powerful drama that explores the complexities of war through the eyes of Chris Kyle, a legendary Navy S.E.A.L. sniper. With Bradley Cooper giving a strong performance and Clint Eastwood directing, this film is sure to leave an impact.

If you're in the mood for something from a different era, I'd recommend "To Have and Have Not" (1937) - it's a classic adventure romance that takes place during World War II, with Humphrey Bogart delivering his signature tough-guy charm.
